Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/8540637195455101
  • Última atualização do currículo em 30/08/2019

Doutor em Ciência da Computação pelo Instituto de Computação da Universidade Estadual de Campinas, Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira possui experiência pós-doutoral no laboratório chave de segurança de mídia da Universidade de Shenzhen, em Guangdong, China, onde pesquisou temas como identificação de adulterações em documentos, atribuições de fonte de documentos digitais e outros temas relevantes em computação forense. Atualmente trabalha no departamento de matemática e informática da Universidade de Cagliari, em Cagliari, Itália, onde atua como pesquisador sênior desenvolvendo soluções em aprendizado de máquina com foco em aplicações de segurança, mercado e indústria. Seus interesses em pesquisa envolvem áreas como Processamento de Imagens, Visão Computacional e Aprendizado de Máquina. É revisor dos períodicos IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics and Security (TIFS), Elsevier Journal of Visual Communication and Image Representation (JVCI), Elsevier Digital Signal Processing (DSP), Springer Multimedia Tools and Applications (MTAP) e Taylor and Francis Australian Journal of Forensic Sciences (TAJF). Possui prêmios por entidades internacionais como a IEEE e a Elsevier e é autor da melhor tese de doutorado de 2016 do Instituto de Computação da Unicamp. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2019 - Atual
Deep features for 2D barcode label anticounterfeiting detection
Descrição: In recent years, the booming development of online merchants has provided new space for the survival of counterfeit and shoddy products, and increased the difficulty of counterfeit and shoddy products. This project intends to use the QR code label to store the anti-counterfeiting features from the surface of the product to verify the authenticity of products from different sales channels. The consumer can photograph the surface of the product to decode the two-dimensional code label and simultaneously extract the anticounterfeiting features of the product, and can judge the authenticity of the product by comparing the label content with the extracted features. This solution can provide new solutions for product anti-counterfeiting problems, reduce the production, verification and rights protection costs of legal parties, and greatly increase the cost of illegally forged goods, thereby safeguarding the national economic interests and people's personal safety..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Mestrado acadêmico: (1) .

Integrantes: Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira - Integrante / Haodong Li - Integrante / Li Mulin - Integrante / Changcheng Chen - Coordenador / CAO SUDAO - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Science and Technology Innovation Commission of Shenzhen - Bolsa.
2019 - Atual
DoUtDes: Trasferimento di tecnologie e competenze di Business Intelligence alle aziende dei settori innovativi e tradizionali
Descrição: Il progetto ha l'obiettivo di creare tra le imprese aderenti nuove competenze negli ambiti dello User Profiling, della Semantic Analisys e dei Big Data applicati al web, al mobile, ai social media e all'Internet of Things. Al termine il progetto vedrà la realizzazione e condivisione di una piattaforma tecnologica di business intelligence (denominata DoUtDes) in grado di consentire alle imprese di sviluppare processi aziendali che sfruttino al massimo le opportunità offerte da questo tipo di tecnologie. Il progetto ha anche come obiettivo il trasferimento alle aziende del cluster delle competenze e metodologie connesse allo sfruttamento dei Big Data allo scopo di migliorare la qualità delle azioni di marketing, advertising, ed evoluzione di prodotto..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira - Integrante / Diego Reforgiato Ricupero - Integrante / Salvatore Carta - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): União Sarda - Bolsa.
2018 - Atual
Two-dimensional code anti-counterfeiting labels and key technologies based on deep features
Descrição: In recent years, the vigorous development of online merchants has provided a new opportunity for the survival of counterfeited and shoddy products. This project intends to use the QR-code label to store the anti-counterfeiting features from the surface of the product to verify the authenticity of products from different sales channels. The consumer can photograph the surface of the product to decode the two-dimensional code label and simultaneously extract the anti-counterfeiting features of the product, and can determine the authenticity of the product by comparing the label content with the extracted features. This solution can provide new approaches for product anti-counterfeiting problems and reduce production, verification and rights costs of legitimate parties, and greatly increase the cost of illegally forged goods, thereby safeguarding national economic interests..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Mestrado acadêmico: (1) .

Integrantes: Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira - Integrante / Li Mulin - Integrante / Changsheng Chen - Coordenador / Cai Sudao - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Science and Technology Innovation Commission of Shenzhen - Auxílio financeiro.
2018 - Atual
Research on Digital Image Forgery Localization in Complex Situations
Descrição: With the rapid development on image processing technology, tampering images without leaving obvious perceptual artifacts becomes much easier, which would lead to serious negative influences on society, politics, economy, criminal investigation，justice and diplomacy. Digital image forensics is a kind of important technique for identifying the originality and authenticity of digital images. The existing forensic methods, however, are still subjected to many constraints and far away from practical applications, and thus they cannot work well on the tricky problem of locating the tampered regions within an image forgery, especially in some complex situations. For example, the images come from different sources, the tampering methods are diverse, and so on. In order to improve the performance of digital image forgery localization, this project will study forgery localization methods in complex situations. The main research topics are as follows: 1. deep learning based framework for forgery localization; 2. construction of forgery localization features for small regions; 3. design of fusion strategies for forgery localization. This project is supposed to break through the key techniques for image forgery localization in practical situations, and improve the theory and solution of image forgery localization, which will further support the practical applications of image forensic techniques..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira - Integrante / Haodong Li - Integrante / Jiwu Huang - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Natural National Science Foundation of China - Auxílio financeiro.
2017 - 2019
Multi Analysis and Deep Learning Techniques for Digital Image Forensics and Classification
Descrição: With the extensive range of image acquisition devices and document generation nowadays, the establishment of computational techniques in order to recognize illegal content and assign authorship can be useful in different ways to a forensic scenario: recognizing the content can help identifying crimes in images, and establishing the owner/author can provide strong arguments to the indictment of a suspect. Different techniques have been proposed in the scientific literature to act in these ways, but often many of them fail because: (1) there is a lack of standardization, i.e., different techniques are proposed for different applications, which may require skilled personnel on each application; (2) the laboratory essence of the process, with only a limited range of known elements being considered for classification, not accounting for the unknown nature of the problems during real-world testing and (3) most of techniques proposed so far are proposed based on feature engineering, built based on patterns that it is not guaranteed to happen always. In this research project, we propose to address these problems on two fronts: resilient characterization and classification. For this, we intend to use multi-analysis approaches, in which we explore several scenarios in the investigation together with data-driven characterization by Convolutional Neural Networks. We also aim at proposing the use of Open-Set classifiers in order to generate the classification taking into account the unknown, which is defined as a class not considered in the classifier training. We intend to apply the developed techniques in three image forensic applications: source attribution, digital image forgery detection and natural image forgery detection. At the end of this project, we aim at establishing new standards for Digital Image Forensics taking into account the real nature of this application..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira - Integrante / HUANG, JIWU - Coordenador.
2014 - 2019
DeepEyes: Visual Computing and Machine Intelligence Techniques for Digital Forensics and Electronic Surveillance
Projeto certificado pelo(a) coordenador(a) Anderson de Rezende Rocha em 04/06/2016.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Anselmo Castelo Branco Ferreira - Integrante / Anderson Rocha - Coordenador / Siome Goldenstein - Integrante / SANTOS, JEFERSSON A. DOS - Integrante / Siovani Felipussi - Integrante / William Robson Schwartz - Integrante / Jacques Wainer - Integrante / Edson Borin - Integrante / David Menotti Gomes - Integrante / Arnaldo Albuquerque de Araújo - Integrante / Nelson Luis Saldanha da Fonseca - Integrante / Flavio de Barros Vidal - Integrante / Dibio Leandro Borges - Integrante / Ricardo da Silva Torres - Integrante / André Luiz da Costa Morisson - Integrante / Paulo Max Gil Innocencio Reis - Integrante / Jorge de Albuquerque Lambert - Integrante / Helio Pedrini - Integrante.
